summary: In a bleak future society, citizens are constantly watched by an all-powerful government. Winston Smith works quietly in the Ministry of Truth, altering historical records to match the Party’s propaganda. Despite his fear, he begins to question the lies that surround him. His secret romance with Julia becomes an act of defiance against authority. The fragile rebellion brings a spark of hope, but also danger that threatens to crush them completely. It is a haunting portrait of control, fear, and the struggle for individuality.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Bilbo Baggins lives a quiet life until the wizard Gandalf and a group of dwarves arrive at his door. Reluctantly, he joins them on a daring quest to recover a lost treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug. Along the journey, he faces trolls, goblins, and riddles with a strange creature named Gollum. Though timid at first, Bilbo discovers cleverness and courage he didn’t know he had. The road is long and full of peril, yet filled with surprising friendships and wonders. His life changes forever in ways he never imagined.

title: Pride and Prejudice
summary: Elizabeth Bennet is a spirited young woman in search of happiness within the confines of English society. She crosses paths with the wealthy but aloof Mr. Darcy, whose pride initially puts her off. As their misunderstandings unfold, Elizabeth discovers there is more depth to his character than she first believed. Her sharp wit and determination challenge the expectations placed on her. Through wit and tension, the story reveals the bonds of family, love, and personal growth. The dance between heart and reason plays out with charm and irony.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary: Nick Carraway moves to Long Island and becomes fascinated with his mysterious neighbor, Jay Gatsby. Gatsby throws dazzling parties filled with glamour and excess, yet all his wealth hides a single obsession: winning back Daisy Buchanan. Through Nick’s eyes, the glittering world of the Jazz Age reveals hidden loneliness and decay. Gatsby’s dream, though powerful, collides with the harsh truth of reality. The story paints a vivid picture of ambition, longing, and loss. Beneath the surface, it questions whether dreams can ever truly be recaptured.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: Young Scout Finch grows up in a small Southern town, where she witnesses the complexities of human behavior. Her father, Atticus, takes on the defense of a man unfairly accused of a terrible crime. Scout learns about kindness and cruelty, both in the courtroom and in the everyday lives of neighbors. Through her eyes, the boundaries between innocence and injustice become clearer. The story balances moments of childhood wonder with stark lessons about fairness and courage. It remains a moving exploration of compassion and integrity.

title: Moby Dick
summary: Ishmael signs up for a whaling voyage aboard the Pequod, only to discover the captain’s consuming obsession. Captain Ahab is determined to hunt down the great white whale that once maimed him. The journey takes the crew across vast and treacherous seas, encountering storms and strange cultures along the way. Tension builds as Ahab’s relentless pursuit grows more dangerous with each passing day. The tale captures the beauty and terror of the ocean. In the end, it becomes a story of obsession that swallows everything in its path.

title: Frankenstein
summary: Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant but reckless scientist, unlocks the secret of creating life. Horrified by his own success, he abandons the creature he brought into the world. Lonely and misunderstood, the being yearns for acceptance but is met only with fear and rejection. Anguish turns into anger, setting off a tragic cycle of pursuit between creator and creation. The story raises questions about ambition and responsibility. It lingers as a chilling reminder of what happens when discovery goes too far.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: Holden Caulfield recounts a few restless days after being expelled from school. Wandering through New York City, he observes the world with sharp criticism and quiet sadness. He struggles to connect with others while longing for honesty in a world he sees as false. His thoughts shift between humor and despair as he drifts from one encounter to the next. Beneath his rebellious tone lies a deep vulnerability. It is a raw, searching look into the confusion of growing up.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
summary: Frodo Baggins inherits a mysterious ring that holds a terrible power. Guided by Gandalf, he sets out with loyal companions to take the ring to safety. Their path crosses enchanted lands, ancient ruins, and dark creatures bent on capturing the ring. The fellowship faces trials that test their trust in one another. Each step draws them closer to the heart of danger. The tale unfolds as a sweeping journey where hope is carried by the smallest of figures.

title: Brave New World
summary: In a future city where comfort and stability are carefully engineered, individuality is almost nonexistent. Children are raised in laboratories, and happiness comes in measured doses. A man who feels out of place begins to question the values of this society. When he meets someone from outside this world, the contrast becomes even starker. What looks like perfection hides emptiness and control. The story leaves readers pondering what it truly means to live freely.

title: Jane Eyre
summary: Jane grows up facing cruelty and hardship but never loses her determination. She finds employment as a governess at Thornfield Hall, where she encounters the enigmatic Mr. Rochester. Their connection deepens, yet secrets within the manor threaten their bond. Jane’s sense of self-worth and morality guide her choices even when tested by love and despair. Her path is marked by independence and inner strength. It is both a romance and a tale of resilience.

title: The Alchemist
summary: Santiago, a shepherd boy, sets out from Spain after dreaming of treasure near the pyramids. His journey takes him across deserts and distant lands, filled with lessons from those he meets. He learns to notice the signs around him and to listen to the quiet voice within. The hardships he faces reveal deeper truths about courage and destiny. Each step brings him closer not just to treasure, but to understanding himself. It is a fable about following one’s calling.

title: Crime and Punishment
summary: Raskolnikov, a struggling student, convinces himself that he is above the law and commits a grave act. Haunted by guilt and suspicion, he isolates himself while battling his own conscience. Encounters with others reveal both his torment and his desire for redemption. His fragile reasoning crumbles under the weight of what he has done. The novel probes the darkest corners of the human mind. It is a portrait of suffering and the possibility of forgiveness.

title: The Little Prince
summary: A pilot stranded in the desert meets a small boy from another planet. Through gentle conversations, the boy shares his observations of life, love, and human folly. His stories of other worlds are whimsical yet carry profound lessons. The simplicity of his words hides a depth that touches the heart. The tale blends childlike wonder with wisdom. It continues to enchant readers of all ages.

title: The Odyssey
summary: Odysseus, king of Ithaca, struggles to return home after the Trojan War. His voyage is filled with perilous encounters with monsters, gods, and temptations. Each challenge delays his journey while his wife Penelope remains steadfast at home. The epic recounts both triumphs and losses on the long road. Odysseus must rely on wit, endurance, and loyalty to survive. It stands as a timeless story of wandering and homecoming.
